ns0:Benchmark.ns0:title: Preupgrade Assistant migration tool

ns0:description.html:p: This is a checklist of configuration settings intended to be used as RedHat Enterprise Linux migration tool.

The checklist can be processed by varius tools which enable users to:
define profiles with customized security policies,
audit systems to determine compliance with targeted security policy and
adjust system configuration.

ns0:Benchmark.ns0:notice: This XCCDF has been automatically generated, it should only serve as a baseline!
ns0:Benchmark.ns0:reference: Defense Information Systems Agency - Security Technical Implementation Guides (DISA STIG)
Payment Card Industry - Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)

ns0:description.html:p: This profile is designed for the Preupgrade Assistant tool.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Configuration Files to Review
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module stores some system configuration files that can have been modified by the user when it is not possible to automatically upgrade them.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: File Lists for Manual Migration
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module generates lists of files, such as temporary, application, and user data files, which are not automatically migrated.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Bacula Backup Software
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module verifies the directory permissions for the Bacula service.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: MySQL configuration
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Check MySQL configuration

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Migration of the MySQL data stack

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Migration of the MySQL data stack
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Migrate the MySQL data stack to the new version of MariaDB

ns0:Group.ns0:title: General changes in default MySQL implementation

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: General changes in default MySQL implementation
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Mind that MySQL is replaced by MariaDB in default MySQL implementation

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: PostgreSQL upgrade content
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: PostgreSQL upgrade content

ns0:Group.ns0:title: GNOME Desktop Environment underwent several design modifications in CentOS 7 release

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: GNOME Desktop Environment underwent several design modifications in CentOS 7 release
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: GNOME Desktop Environment underwent several design modifications in CentOS 7 release.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: KDE Desktop Environment underwent several design modifications in CentOS 7 release

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: KDE Desktop Environment underwent several design modifications in CentOS 7 release
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: KDE Desktop Environment underwent several design modifications in CentOS 7 release.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: several graphic drivers not supported in CentOS 7

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: several graphic drivers not supported in CentOS 7
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Several graphic drivers packages were deprecated or removed in CentOS 7.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: several input drivers not supported in CentOS 7

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: several input drivers not supported in CentOS 7
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Several input drivers packages were deprecated or removed in CentOS 7.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: several kernel networking drivers not available in CentOS 7

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: several kernel networking drivers not available in CentOS 7
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Several kernel networking drivers were removed from CentOS 7.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: several kernel storage drivers not available in CentOS 7

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: several kernel storage drivers not available in CentOS 7
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Several kernel storage drivers were deprecated or removed in CentOS 7.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Names, Options and Output Format Changes in arptables

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Names, Options and Output Format Changes in arptables
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The basic chain names, some command-line options, and some output formats have been changed between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. Additionally, the name of the packages has been changed from arptables_jf to arptables. This module provides you with the list of incompatibilities.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: BIND9 running in a chroot environment check.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: BIND9 running in a chroot environment check.
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The way how BIND9 running in a chroot environment is started changed between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This module checks if chroot environment specific packages for BIND9 have been installed and points the administrator to the Red Hat Knowledgebase article.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: BIND9 configuration compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Checks BIND9 configuration compatibility
File(s) affected:
/etc/named.conf

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Move dhcpd/dhcprelay arguments from /etc/sysconfig/* to *.service files

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Move dhcpd/dhcprelay arguments from /etc/sysconfig/* to *.service files
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Files /etc/sysconfig/[dhcpd|dhcrelay] containing customization arguments are deprecated in favour of *.service files. The arguments are automatically moved during update. This content checks if user specified any arguments and if so, informs him about the move.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: DNSMASQ configuration compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Checks DNSMASQ configuration compatibility
File(s) affected:
/etc/dnsmasq.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Dovecot configuration compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Checks Dovecot configuration compatibility
File(s) affected:
/etc/dovecot/dovecot.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Compatibility Between iptables and ip6tables
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
The firewalld service is now the default firewall service.
File(s) affected:
/etc/sysconfig/iptables
/etc/sysconfig/ip6tables

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Net-SNMP check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Check if Net-SNMP daemon (snmpd) is enabled.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Squid configuration compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Checks squid configuration compatibility
File(s) affected:
/etc/squid/squid.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Reusable Configuration Files
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The module provides a list of the configuration files that can be reused in CentOS 7.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: VCS repositories
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Find Versin Control System repositories in /home and /root - git, svn, cvs, bzr.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Added and extended options for BIND9 configuration

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Added and extended options for BIND9 configuration
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some useful options have been added or extended in the configuration of the Berkeley Internet Name Domain (BIND9) utility on CentOS 7. This module provides overview of the changes in the options between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Added options in DNSMASQ configuration
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some useful options were added in DNSMASQ configuration between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This informative content lists such changes.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Packages not signed by CentOS
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Packages not signed by CentOS will not be upgraded

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Obsoleted rpms
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some rpms were obsoleted from the set of the packages between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This content checks for the package obsoletes from your set of CentOS packages.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: w3m not available in CentOS 7
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The w3m package is not available in CentOS 7.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: report incompatibilities between CentOS 6 and 7 in qemu-guest-agent package

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: report incompatibilities between CentOS 6 and 7 in qemu-guest-agent package
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Report incompatibilities between CentOS 6 and 7 in qemu-guest-agent package.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Removed options in coreutils binaries
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some options and binaries were removed from coreutils package between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This informative content lists the incompatibilities.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Removed options in gawk binaries
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some options and binaries were removed from gawk package between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This informative content lists the incompatibilities.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Removed options in netstat binary
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some options were removed from netstat binary between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This informative content lists the incompatibilities.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Removed options in quota tools
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some options have been renamed at quota tools between CentOS and 7. This informative content lists the incompatibilities.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Removed rpms
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some rpms were removed from the set of the packages between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This content checks for the package removals from your set of CentOS packages.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Replaced rpms
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some rpms were replaced between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This content checks for the package replacements from your set of CentOS packages and generates the list of CentOS packages/yum groups for CentOS 7 kickstart.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: GMP library incompatibilities
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Incompatibilities between GMP 4 and GMP 5.1 libraries.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: optional channel problems
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: detects upgrade problems with RHEL optional channel

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: package downgrades
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: detects package downgrades from CentOS6 to CentOS7

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: restore custom selinux configuration
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Content with postupgrade script that restores custom selinux configuration.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: General
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: There has to be some steps performed in order to have working SELinux on CentOS 7.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: samba shared directories selinux
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Samba shared directories that might need their selinux context restored.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: CUPS Browsing/BrowsePoll configuration
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
The CUPS Browsing and BrowsePoll configuration directives have been removed from CUPS. A replacement is provided in the form of the cups-browsed service.
File(s) affected:
/etc/cups/cupsd.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: CVS Package Split
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some Concurrent Versions System (CVS) tools and documentation have been moved into separate packages and are no longer provided by the cvs packages.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: FreeRADIUS Upgrade Verification
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module determines if there is a version of the FreeRADIUS service prior to version 3.x installed on the system. These earlier versions have an incompatible configuration and need to be configured manually using the resources mentioned below.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: httpd configuration compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Checks httpd configuration compatibility
File(s) affected:
/etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: bind-dyndb-ldap
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Check configuration file for bind-dyndb-ldap plug-in.
File(s) affected:
/etc/named.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Identity Management Server compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Checks Identity Management Server (IPA) configuration compatibility
File(s) affected:
/etc/ipa/default.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: IPA Server CA Verification
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
This module verifies the IPA CA configuration compatibility.
File(s) affected:
/etc/sysconfig/pki/ca/*

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: NTP configuration
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Save ntp and ntpdate configuration files which are not tracked by rpm.
File(s) affected:
/etc/ntp.conf
/etc/ntp/step-tickers

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Information on time-sync.target
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Check if ntpdate service is enabled and print information on starting services with clock set

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: OpenLDAP /etc/sysconfig and data compatibility
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Some shell variables and minor syntax have been changed in the OpenLDAP sysconfig file between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This module detects such changes and advices the user with possible solution. The module also advices the user on how to proceed with a database upgrade.
File(s) affected:
/etc/sysconfig/ldap

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: OpenSSH sshd_config migration content
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
This content has a aim to convert /etc/ssh/sshd_config file from openssh-server package
File(s) affected:
/etc/ssh/sshd_config

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: OpenSSH sysconfig migration content
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
This content has a aim to convert /etc/sysconfig/sshd file from openssh-server package
File(s) affected:
/etc/sysconfig/sshd

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Configuration for quota_nld service
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Back configuration for quota_nld service up
File(s) affected:
/etc/sysconfig/quota_nld

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Disk quota netlink message daemon moved into quota-nld package

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Disk quota netlink message daemon moved into quota-nld package
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Install quota-nld package if the quota_nld service is enabled

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: SSSD compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
'Checks sssd configuration compatibility'
File(s) affected:
/etc/sssd/sssd.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Luks encrypted partition
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Checks whether partition is crypted by CRYPTO-LUKS.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Clvmd and cmirrord daemon management.
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The clvmd and cmirrord daemon needs to be defined as 'clvm' cluster resource instead of running it as a system service.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: State of LVM2 services.
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Some services are important for proper LVM functionality. This content checks for current state of existing services and makes sure the state is preserved over upgrade. Also, some systemd units should be enabled by default to allow for service's on-demand activation if needed.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: device-mapper-multipath configuration compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Checks multipath configuration compatibility. Also, removes old udev multipath rules.
File(s) affected:
/etc/multipath.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Removal of scsi-target-utils
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
The scsi-target-utils packages are no longer available in CentOS 7.
File(s) affected:
/etc/tgt/targets.conf

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Configuration for warnquota tool
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Back configuration for warnquota tool up
File(s) affected:
/etc/quotagrpadmins
/etc/quotatab
/etc/warnquota.conf

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Disk quota tool warnquota moved into quota-warnquota package

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Disk quota tool warnquota moved into quota-warnquota package
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Install quota-warnquota if need warnquota tool

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Check for Add-On availability
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Content checks availability of High Availability, ResilientStorage and LoadBalancer Add-Ons.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Architecture Support
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: CentOS 7 does not support installations on 32-bit architectures, and performing an in-place upgrade is not possible on 32-bit systems.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Binary rebuilds
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Check all binaries installed on the assessment system which needs to be rebuilded on the target system

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Debuginfo packages
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This content checks for debuginfo packages and inform about potential risks for in-place upgrade.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Cluster and High Availablility
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Content checks Cluster and High Availability solutions for upgrade.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: fix krb5kdc config file
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The content that fixes the /etc/sysconfig/krb5kdc file.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: File Systems, Partitions and Mounts Configuration Review

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: File Systems, Partitions and Mounts Configuration Review
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module describes the new default file system and stores the partitions and mounts configuration.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Read Only FHS directories
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Check that critical directories of Filesystem Hierarchy Standard are not mounted read-only.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server variant

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server variant
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Upgrade is supported only to Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server variant.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Sonamebumped libs
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: If the dynamic library breaks the API/ABI compatibility, it is supposed to change its soname. This content checks for the soname bumps between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7 in your CentOS packages.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: SonameKept Reusable Dynamic Libraries
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module provides an overview of the dynamic libraries from CentOS 6 that can be reused in CentOS 7, as the dynamic libraries remain compatible with both the application programming interface (API) and the application binary interface (ABI).

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Removed .so libs
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Dynamic libraries are used provides symbols/functions to binaries. Some of the libraries were removed between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This content checks for the .so libraries removal between CentOS 6 and CentOS 7 in your CentOS packages.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: In-place Upgrade Requirements for the /usr/ Directory

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: In-place Upgrade Requirements for the /usr/ Directory
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module determines if the /usr/ directory is located on a separate partition.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: CA certificate bundles modified
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Later versions of CentOS include a shared store for certificate authorities. Additional trusted certificate authorities must be placed in the new location rather that modifying the distributed certificate authority bundles. The Preupgrade assistant cannot automatically identify how certificate bundles have been modified on this system.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Developer Tool Set packages
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Content checks whether Red Hat Developer Tool Set packages are installed.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Hyper-V
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Check if this system runs on Hyper-V.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Content for enabling and disabling services based on CentOS 6 system

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Content for enabling and disabling services based on CentOS 6 system
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The content checks what services are enabled or disabled on assessment system and if the services will be enabled or disabled on CentOS 7 system.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Check for ethernet interface naming
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The content checks if network interface names set through /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-* files are compatible with device naming in CentOS 7.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: User modification in /etc/rc.local and /etc/rc.d/rc.local
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: The content checks whether user modifies files /etc/rc.local and /etc/rc.d/rc.local

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: cgroups configuration compatibility check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Checks libcgroup configuration files
File(s) affected:
/etc/cgconfig.conf
/etc/cgrules.conf
/etc/cgconfig.d

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Plugable authentication modules (PAM)
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Content checks for no-longer supported pluggable authentication modules

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Foreign Perl modules
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Find Perl modules which need to be checked for proper functionality with newer Perl version on the CentOS 7 system because they are not distributed by CentOS

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Python 2.7.5
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module provides you with a list of packages that need to be rebuilt for version 2.7.5 of the Python programming language that is shipped with CentOS 7.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Ruby 2.0.0
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module provides you with a list of packages that need to be rebuilt for version 2.0.0 of the Ruby programming language, which is shipped with CentOS 7.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: SCL collections
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Content checks whether RHSCL are installed

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Red Hat Network Classic Unsupported
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module determines if this system is registered with the Red Hat Network Classic.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Red Hat Subscription Manager
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This module adds new option to the configuration file, if it is not there already.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: System kickstart
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Copy system kickstart from /root/ to directory with results

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: YUM
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Content checks YUM configuration file

ns0:Group.ns0:title: Check for usage of dangerous range of UID/GIDs

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Check for usage of dangerous range of UID/GIDs
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: In CentOS 6, limit for system accounts was 500, in CentOS 7 it was raised to 1000. Therefore some user accounts might be in this range. In addition, usage of unreserved ids between 0 and 200 is prohibited. This content checks for these two violations of standards which may bring issues during migration.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: Incorrect usage of reserved UID/GIDs
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Reserved user and group IDs by setup package changed between the CentOS 6 and CentOS 7. This may in some cases cause the unfunctionality of your system after the migration. This check should mitigate the risks.

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: NIS ypbind config files back-up
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Saving NIS ypbind config files.
File(s) affected:
/etc/yp.conf
/etc/sysconfig/ypbind

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: NIS Makefile back-up
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Content for saving NIS Makefile for generationg maps.
File(s) affected:
/var/yp/Makefile

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: NIS server maps check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: This content only warns user that maps need to be re-generated because a different back-end format is used in CentOS 7 for caching maps.

ns0:Group.ns0:title: NIS server MAXUID and MAXGID limits check

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: NIS server MAXUID and MAXGID limits check
ns0:Rule.ns0:description: Check if some users managed by NIS ypserv use UID/GID between 500 and 1000, which might cause issues after upgrade

ns0:Rule.ns0:title: NIS server config file back-up
ns0:Rule.ns0:description:
Content for saving NIS ypserv and yppasswdd config files.
File(s) affected:
/etc/ypserv.conf
/etc/sysconfig/yppasswdd
